column4: I set all the volume (master and everything else) all the way up, and get white noise from my speakers, but it still won't output sound from videos or anything else online
oh, it also won't play startup music
it's just the integrated audio from the motherboard
I dual booted for a while and it worked then
after having recently switched my family computer entirely to ubuntu I am having sound issues.......it won't play back anything from internet or startup music
Ok, do a sudo lshw -C Sound
this will give us what driver you are using and the hardware :)
hold on have to switch users
alright post the driver in use and the product line.
It looks like the module that is loaded needs to be configured. there are bugs filed. one sec looking for solution. 9.10?
how do I check pm in irssi?
We are going to need to edit the alsa-base.conf file
I will let you know what to edit inside that file.
The easiest way is to CTRL + F to find this: power_save_
towards the bottom of the file
I am going to post 2 different lines. add it to the very bottom of that file. ok?
I have edited files before. I do have *some* idea what I'm doing
Line 1 : # Power down HDA controllers after 10 idle seconds
the first one does, meaning the one before login, but not the one after login
what else could the problem be?
thanks. tell me when and if you do
On your sound configuration choose analog stereo, not HDMI.
there is a speaker in the upper right hand corner, right click and choose preferences
click on the hardware tab and towards the bottom by "profile" what set it to Analog
none. just a dropdown menu and a list of options like LFE and side
I found a few more. We can try them I suppose
It states that the settings are for a laptop, hopefully it does not matter.
what file and what to do to it?
We are going to add 3 lines to the bottom of it
It has got to be a sound prefernce somewhere.
can you post a screenshot of your sound setting window into pastebin?
what is under the devices tab?
also, what shows up when you click the preferences button at the bottom?
you see the small window open? that's it.
under the devices drop down try to 3rd and 5th options...
